summary: An email update from March 19, 2008, regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case in Palm Beach. It discusses the grand jury presentation, harassment of victims by Epstein's lawyers, a victim's suicide attempt, and efforts to secure legal representation and counseling for victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the grand jury presentation and indictment; his lawyers are described as harassing victims.

events.title: Grand jury presentation on Epstein indictment
events.description: The first half of the grand jury presentation on the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein was conducted. Grand jurors expressed thanks and one juror mentioned prior concern about the case being 'whitewashed'.

events.title: Scheduled victim deposition
events.description: A deposition for one of the victims is scheduled for Monday, March 24, 2008.

events.title: Victim suicide attempt
events.description: One of the victims tried to commit suicide the previous week.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: Epstein's lawyers were using the legal process to harass victims, including serving a subpoena for a deposition.
A national crime victims service organization received a DOJ grant to provide legal representation to the victims, though finding local pro bono lawyers was a challenge.
One victim attempted suicide the week prior, highlighting the severe psychological toll of the case.
The FBI's victim-witness coordinator was working to secure counseling for victims, but the prolonged legal process was causing strain.
The email expresses frustration that Epstein's team remained 'on the attack' while prosecutors were 'forced to wait on the sidelines'.
